decision_conditions: The proposed development by reason of its appearance, design and roof profile would be out of character with the adjoining residential properties and would result in an intensive development that is out of keeping with the grain and pattern of development in the area, and would be visually incongruous and overbearing to the detriment of the visual and residential character of the locality as a whole, contrary to section 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 1.1 (g), 1.2 (h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policies ELV 7.4 and 7.B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document. | The proposed accommodation, by reason of the poor levels of outlook to main and secondary bedrooms, residential units with long and narrow main living spaces and the location of amenity provision around vehicular access would result in a residential development of substandard quality, poor outlook and poor privacy levels for  prospective occupiers to the detriment of their residential amenity and contrary to section 6 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 3.5, 7.1 and 7.4 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 7.B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document. | The proposed development by reason of the creation of a vehicular access, hardstanding and the off street parking arrangement to the rear is out of keeping with the pattern of development in the area, and would be visually incongruous and overbearing to the detriment of the visual and residential character of the locality as a whole, contrary to section 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 1.1 (g), 1.2 (h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policies ELV 7.4 and 7.B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document. | The proposal is considered to be a harmful development, detrimental to the residential amenity of neighbouring occupiers and the enjoyment of their rear gardens, by way of the creation of a vehicular access, hardstanding and the off street parking arrangement to the rear contrary section 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 7.1 and 7.4 of the London Plan 2011, policies 4.1 and policies 1.1 (g), of the adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 and policy 7.B of the draft Ealing Development Management Plan Document (published February 2013).
description: Conversion of existing mixed used building to create 5 residential flats (2 x 1bed and 3 x 2bed) and retention of ground floor laundrette and retail units, incorporating two storey rear and single storey side extensions; alteration to side openings and fenestration; and vehicular access with parking space and refuse storage
